info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN DARKE AND SOUTH CENTRAL MERCER COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles south of Fort Recovery, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Osgood, Burkettsville, North Star, Rossburg, New Weston, Yorkshire, Brock, Eldora Speedway, North Dayton, Rose Hill and Cosmos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
